name: Human
desc: Humans represent the best and worst of civilization, and every other part of the spectrum, and are known primarily for their short lives, industriousness, and their lasting institutions.
age: Humans reach adulthood in their late teens and have a typical lifespan of 80 years.

size.desc: Humans vary widely in height and build, from barely 5 feet to well over 6 feet tall. Regardless of your position in that range, your size is Medium.

tenaciousWill: You gain proficiency in Willpower Saves.

name: Dwarf
desc: These stocky folk of a height between Humans and Halflings, and heavier than both, of all the races that shun the sun have no weakness to it. They're renowned smiths and artisans with clever fingers many shards-over. A commitment to family or clan and unearthing lost traditions, and a burning hatred of drow and other dark creatures, are the common threads that unite all dwarves.
age: Dwarves mature slower than humans, until their 30's, but they're considered young until they reach the age of 50. On average, they live about 350 years.

size.desc: Dwarves stand between 4 and 5 feet tall and average about 150 pounds. Your size is Medium

loadBearing: Your speed is not reduced by wearing heavy armor.
darkVision: You can see in dim light within 60ft of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of grey.
stoneSense: You have Tremorsense up to a 15ft radius through earth & stone, when standing on connected ground.
homogeneous: You can only choose 1 Racial Power

name: Elf
desc: Elves are a ethereal people, long-lived and a reflection of the pre-world that moulded them. The Fey drifted to one of two fates; living in places of natural beauty and terrible primalcy, ancient forests, oases of deep deserts, the watery depths of vibrant reefs; or to the courts and intrigues of mortal cities playing soft music that drifts through the air and crafting gentle fragrances to counter the city stench. Coming to be called Wild Elves and Grey Elves, respectively.
age: Although elves reach physical maturity at about the same age as humans (unless the child doesn't wish to group up yet), the elven understanding of adulthood goes beyond physical growth to encompass worldly experience. A wild elf typically claims adulthood and an adult name around the age of 100 and can live for a millenium or more, depending on how intertwined with nature they are. Elves deep in the glades are rumoured to never age, whereas more urbane Elves seems to share lifespans of 'only' a century or three.

size.desc: Elves range from under 5 to over 6 feet tall and have slender builds and exaggerated features. Your size is Medium.

keenSight: You can see further and clearer than other races, details rising to notice faster. You add your Bonus to any Perception checks for sight, when no Skill is in use.
trance: Elves cannot sleep. Their blood is severed from dreams. Instead they meditate deeply, remaining conscious but unobservant. While meditating, Elves make a pale attempt at dreaming; such dreams are actually mental exercises that have become reflexive after years of practice. After resting in this way for 4 hours, you gain the same benefit a human would from 8 hours of sleep.
feyAncestry: You have advantage on saving throws against being Charmed, and magic can't put you to Sleep.

name: Gnome
desc: A constant hum of busy activity pervades the warrens and neighborhoods where gnomes live, at least for the time they're there. Louder sounds punctuate the hum: a crunch of grinding gears here, a minor magical explosion there, a yelp of surprise, and especially bursts of laughter and cries of 'Eureka'!
age: Gnomes mature at the same rate as humans, and most are expected to settle into adult life around the age of 40. They can live to 350 years on average, but it's not too uncommon for them to reach 500 years of age.

size.desc: Gnomes are between 3 and 4 feet tall and weigh around 40 pounds. Your size is Small.

gnomeCunning: Magic and formulae comes to your people easily, and can be just as easily refuted. You have Advantage on all Willpower saves against memetics and magic spells, but not spell-like effects
chromopalsy: If you go 24 hours without experiencing something new, you have Disadvantage on all Willpower saves against resisting temptations, be they from the world, charms of a creature or effects of a spell or spell-like effect.

name: Halfling
desc: Humans call them Halflings, but they call themselves "The Little People" in their own language, which by-and-large they keep secret. They are ubiquitous, sometimes more so even than humans. Halflings covet and espouse the comforts of home, and work readily with others, well known for their loyalty to their friends, no matter in what shape or size they come.
age: Typical mature rate and age of majority, avergage lifespan

size.desc: Halflings average about 3 feet tall and weigh about 40 pounds. Your size is Small.

lucky: When you roll a 1 on an attack roll, ability check, or saving throw, you can reroll the die. You must use the new result, even if it is a 1.
brave: You have advantage on saving throws against being Frightened.

name: Half-Elf
desc: One of the most common and well known of the bloodlines is the green blood, the Fae-Touched Half-Elves. Walking in two worlds but truly belonging to neither, they combine what some say are the best qualities of their Elf and Human parents: Human industriousnous, inventiveness, and ambition tempered by the refined senses, love of subtlety, and artistic expression of the Elves.
age: Half-Elves age at much the same rate as humans, reaching adulthood in their late teens. Depending on the strength of the Fae-Touch, they can live much longer than Humans, exceeding 2 centuries.

size.desc: Half-Elves are more or less the same size as humans, ranging from 5 to 6 feet tall. Your size is Medium.

versatileHeritage: Your people pull on a broad history of mixing between human and fae, and each Half-Elf is as distinct from each other as an elf is to a man. You pick 3 Racial Powers instead of 2.

name: Tuskman
desc: The curse of Gruumsh and the raging Legions of Terror are now old enough to be more myth than legend, but even now their mark, and the spectre of still-raving cousins, marks orcs in eyes of society. Today Orcs that can keep their "Red Rage" at bay call themselves Tuskmen. They join civilized society or form more communities of their own, where they fight against the legacy of their ancestors.
age: Tuskmen mature faster than humans, reaching adulthood around age 14, and they age noticeably faster and rarely live longer than 60 years

size.desc: Tuskmen are somewhat larger and bulkier than humans, and they range from 5 to well over 6 feet tall. Your size is Medium.

keenHearingAndSmell: You add your Bonus to any Perception checks for hearing or smell, when no Skill is in use.
redRage: Even now your people bear Grummsh' mark, and though any tuskman can throw off the yolk, sometimes they choose to indulge. In addition to your Racial Power choices, you can also take one of: Adrenaline Rush, Menacing, Relentless Endurance, Savage Attacks or Savage Magic.

name: Dragonborn
desc: Various dragons over the ages have twisted humanoids into their own likeness, the dragonborn, out of jealous imitation or genuine desire, or perhaps on the whimsy of granting a mad man's request. Those twisted by the dragon's curse gain many physical benefits and magical powers, not least biological immortality, but many revile their visage, the crippling drawbacks unique to each hue, and the dragon madness; that hungering greed - the hollowing emptiness that can never be filled.
age: Young dragonborn grow quickly. They walk hours after leaving the pouch, attain the size and development of a 10-year-old human child by the age of 3, and reach physical maturity by 7. Draconic energy sets them apart, and they don't grow old, only slowly increasing in size year by year until death takes them, typically violence from the fearful or starvation from lack of sustanence for the constant growth.

size.desc: Young dragonborn are on par with humans in height if skinnier, with adult dragonborn being taller and heavier, standing well over 6ft tall and averaging almost 250 pounds. Your size if you're a young or adult Dragonborn is Medium.

Rarer to find are elder Dragonborn who stand over 9ft tall, weighing over 300 pounds. Your size is Large. 

Some mythical 'ancient' Dragonborn are said to be as tall as giants, their size being Huge or greater, but such rare and terrible creatures are not fit for Player Characters.

draconicAncestry:
You are distantly related to a particular kind of dragon. Choose a type of dragon from the table below; this determines the effect, area and type of your breath weapon.

| Dragon Ancestry | Effect | Area | Save |
| --- | --- | --- | --- |
| Black | Acid - 1d10 fire damage on a failed save, and half as much damage on a successful one. | 5ft by 30ft line | Reflex save |
| Blue | Lightning - 1d10 lightning damage on a failed save, and half as much damage on a successful one. | 5ft by 30ft line | Reflex save |
| Brass | Sleep - On a failed save, the character falls unconscious for 1 minute. This effect ends for a character if the character takes damage or someone uses an Action to wake it.| 5ft by 30ft line | Willpower save |
| Bronze | Repulsion - On a failed save, the character is pushed to the nearest free space at the end of the effect's line area. | 5ft by 30ft line | Reflex save |
| Copper | Slow - On a failed save, the character's speed is halved, and it can't make more than one attack in the Round, and they can use either an Action or a Bonus Action in the Round, but not both. These effects last for 1 minute. The character can repeat the saving throw at the end of each Round, ending the effect on with a successful save. | 5ft by 30ft line | Willpower save |
| Green | Poison - 1d6 poison damage and suffer the Poison condition on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. | 15ft cone | Fortitude save |
| Gold | Weaken - On a failed save, the character has disadvantage on Strength-based attack rolls, Strength checks, and Fortitude saving throws for 1 minute. A character can repeat the saving throw at the end of each Round, ending the effect on itself on a success. | 15ft cone | Fortitude save |
| Red | Fire - 1d10 fire damage on a failed save, and half as much damage on a successful one. | 15ft cone | Reflex save |
| Silver | Paralyse - on a failed save, the character is paralyzed for the next Round. | 15ft cone | Fortitude save |
| White | Cold - 1d10 cold damage on a failed save, and half as much damage on a successful one. | 15ft cone | Fortitude save |
breathWeapon: You can use your Action to exhale primeval draconic energy. When you use your breath weapon, all characters in the area must make a saving throw, the type of which is determined by the Ancestry table above, against the effect described. The DC of the save is 8 + your Fortitude + your Bonus. You may use your breath weapon a number of times equal to your Fortitude (minimum 1). You regain expended uses on a Short Rest.

name: Goblinoid
desc:
Goblins are small, squat creatures whose heads are almost too large for their bodies. They have tan skin that has orange and blue highlights that stand out in any terrain and a mouth filled with too many sharp teeth, often riddle with forgotten bits of rotting meat. They use their claw-like nails or crude clubs to attack their foes.

Goblins struggle in their manic compulsions, typically towards acquiring shiny things and being vicious. And yet they can, in time, transform from their pitiful selves into Bugbears (powerful ones) or Nilbogs (smart ones), and from there into upright and prideful Hobgoblins.
age: Goblinoids are born as Goblins and mature quickly, reaching physical maturity at 6 years. If they fail to undergo metamorphosis they do not tend to live long, and finding a goblin older than 35 is rare. Hobgoblin lifetimes, if not cut short by war, are the same as Humans, usually living for 80 years.

size.desc: Goblins and Nilbogs are diminutive yet varied, ranging from 2 to 4 feet in height. Your size is Small.
Bugbears and Hobgoblins stand tall and stooped (in the former) or proud (in the later). Your size is Medium.

darkVision: You can see in dim light within 60ft of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.
giftOfMaglubiyet: Goblinoids are born of stuggle and strife, and adapt and grow accordingly. When you take the Statistic Increase Power, you can choose to evolve. If your new Intelligence is +2 or more, you can evolve from Goblin to Nilbog. If your new Strength is +2 or more, you can evolve from Goblin to Bugbear. If you're already Bugbear or Nilbog, and your new Strength and Intelligence are both +2 or more, you can evolve to Hobgoblin. Additionally, you can swap one or both of your Racial Powers for ones you have the prerequisites for when you evolve any time you take the Statistic Increase Power.
furyOfTheSmall: If you are a Goblin: when you damage a character with an attack or a spell and the character's size is larger than yours, you can cause the attack or spell to deal extra damage to the character. The extra damage equals your Bonus. Once you use this trait, you can't use it again until you finish a Short Rest.
legacyOfEvolution: If you are a Nilbog or Bugbear, choose one Racial Power from your previous Evolution to make an inherant racial trait for you. If you are a Hobgoblin, choose two.

name: Djinn
desc: The four fundamental physical forms of the Material Plane - Air, earth, fire, and water, beget the four types of Djinn. Some are direct descendants of actual genies yet resident in the Elemental Braid, while others were born to a bloodline suffused with elemental magic that once again manifests.
age: A typical Djinn has a life span of 120 years

size.desc: Human origin Djinn, like Humans, vary widely in height and build, from barely 5 feet to well over 6 feet tall. Regardless of your position in that range, your size is Medium.
Halflings who contain the touch of the elements also average about 3 feet tall and weigh about 40 pounds. Your size is Small.

elementalHeritage:
Choose one of the four elements that is your heritage: Earth, Air, Fire, Water. Depending on your heritage you gain the following benefits:

**Earth**
 - *Earth Walk* - You can move across difficult terrain without expending extra movement if you are using your walking speed on the ground or a floor.
 - *Bludgeoning Resistance* - You have resistance to non-magical bludgeoning damage.

**Air**
 - *Unending Breath* - You can hold your breath indefinitely while you’re not incapacitated.
 - *Lightning Resistance* - You have resistance to lightning damage.

**Fire**
 - *Nimble* - You can move through the space of any character that is of a size larger than yours, and you gain proficiency in Acrobatics or Athletics (your choice). You have Advantage on Athletics or Acrobatics (depending on which you chose) checks to escape being Grappled.
 - *Fire Resistance* - You have resistance to fire damage.

**Water**
 - *Amphibious* - You can breathe air and water.
 - *Slashing Resistance* - You have resistance to non-magical slashing damage.

name: Goliath
desc: Goliaths seem to be giantkin humans, and they will tell you in repitition that they're family with the great giants, though the Giants themselves remain tight-lipped. Scholars would argue that such a relation is impossible, as impossible as the union of a man and halfling. Yet they exist, far taller than humans, and honouring the Ordnung in their clans. Though many will note that they're still not within a hairs breadth of the size of even smaller true giants, and that they don't seem to be bound to the elements in any way like the giants, just an affinity for mountains and rock.
age: Goliaths have lifespans comparable to humans. They enter adulthood in their late teens and usually live 80 years

size.desc: Goliaths are between 8 and 10ft tall and weigh between 280 and 380 pounds. Your size is Large.

raceOfAthletes: Competitions of strength, daring and skill are core to your people. You have proficiency in Athletics.
stonesEndurance:
You can supernaturally draw on unyielding stone to shrug off harm. When you take damage, you can use your Action to roll a d12. Add your Fortitude to the number rolled and reduce the damage by that total.

You can use this racial trait a number of times equal to your Bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a Long Rest.
